message.content: This question requires a basic understanding of how lighthouses guide ships. As a ship sails further away from a lighthouse, the angle at which the lighthouse's beam reaches the ship decreases, making it less effective in guiding the ship. Option (B) is incorrect because the ship would actually be less guided by the lighthouse's beam. Option (C) is unrelated to the guiding effect of the lighthouse's beam. Option (D) is irrelevant to the question and not related to the guiding effect of the lighthouse's beam.

This means that the ship will be less guided by the beam and have a harder time keeping its course. Option (B) is incorrect because the ship will actually be guided less by the beam. Option (C) is unrelated to the effects of the distance from the lighthouse. Option (D) is unrelated because the presence of rough ocean waters is not determined by the distance from the lighthouse.
